title: New Roman System of Scripts
desc: The Old Roman System of scripts undergoes a change between the 2nd and 4th centuries AD, creating the New Roman system, which is influenced by Old Roman Cursive and Greek Uncial (especially BR Uncial).

children.title: Uncial (Littera Uncialis)
children.desc: Round, roots in Literary Cursive, very few abbreviations (only abbreviations are used for nomina sacra).

children.title: Merovingian Uncial
children.desc: Flat head ascender of D, hook on head of T, clowed bow E, sharp diagonal stroke on Y, etc.

children.title: Half Uncial
children.desc: More rapid than Uncial, smaller strokes, straight pen, upright ductus

children.title: New Roman Cursive
children.desc: Result of reform of cursive scripts from s. iii<sup>ex</sup> - s. iv<sup>in</sup>. Quicker, loops introduced. Influence on Hald Uncial.
